III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, staff member threatened an autistic youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Complainant/Therapist was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 2/6/24. Therapist reported a family therapy session and
treatment plan meeting was held on 2/5/24 with him, Youth A,
Mother, and Behavior Analyst. During the meeting, Youth A
shared feelings he is mistreated at the facility. Youth A explained
he feels that way because he feels other youth get away with
things and staff members have favorite youth on the unit, but he’s
not one of them. Therapist stated Youth A reported during the
meeting Staff 1 had threatened him, but he didn’t tell anyone
about what happened at the time. Therapist reported Youth A
refused to provide any other details about the situation. Therapist
reported Youth A alluded to the fact he had a plan or scheme in
place and didn’t want to share any details with anyone because he
would “make it right” on his own. Therapist reported Youth A
implied there was another staff member aware of the situation with
Staff 1 but wouldn’t disclose the staff member’s name.
Behavior Analyst (BA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 2/6/24. BA reported during the treatment planning
portion of the meeting they held on 2/5/24, Youth A had a
rebuttal/combative response for every goal they went over. One of
the goals, Youth A said, “well how am I supposed to work on [this
goal] if Staff 1 says ‘if you come out of your room one more time,
I’m going to hit you?’” BA reported they asked Youth A when this
occurred, but he couldn’t provide a timeline, and instead said, “it
happens all the time”. BA reported Therapist asked Youth A why
he didn’t’ previously report it and Youth A said he reported it to a
staff member but wouldn’t disclose who. Youth A then told them
the staff member he disclosed this to told him “We aren’t going to
say anything. It can be between us, and I’m going to say anything
to anyone else”. BA reported Youth A said he had a plan for Staff
1 to get what was coming to her but wouldn’t disclose what the
plan was. BA reported all of Youth A’s previous complaints have
been staff members play favorites and he always gets in trouble.
Mother was interviewed via phone on 2/12/24. Mother is
Youth A’s mother. Mother reported Youth A has been making
complaints about Staff 1 since he arrived at the facility. Mother
reported Youth A has often alleged staff members have favorites.
Mother reported during the meeting on 2/5/24, Youth A stated
Staff 1 said “If you keep getting in someone’s business, I’m going
to fuck you up” or “I’m going to whoop your ass myself”. Mother
2

reported she couldn’t remember which wording he used because
she didn’t write verbatim what he said.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/12/24.
Youth A reported Staff 1 threatened him around September 2023.
Youth A reported Staff 1 said “If you don’t get in the shower this
morning, then you can’t go to school. If you don’t go to school, I’ll
hit you personally.” Youth A reported he thinks that’s what she
said, but he can’t remember a lot because it’s been a while. Youth
A reported he couldn’t remember if any other staff or youth were
present when she said this. Youth A reported when Staff 1 said
this to him, he didn’t feel threatened because Staff 1 acts big and
scary, but he’s not scared of her. Youth A reported he can’t
remember much about anything else she’s done but suggested
talking to Staff 2. Youth A reported he discloses all his complaints,
including this one, to Staff 2. Youth A reported Staff 2 told him
they weren’t going to do anything about it yet, but she would help
later. Youth A reported Staff 2 told him she was going to keep
track of all the things Staff 1 does wrong, so she can talk to
someone all at once about the concerns. Youth A reported he did
not tell anyone else about the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/12/24.
Staff 1 reported she does not remember any incident surrounding
Youth A not taking a shower or giving her problems about taking a
shower before school in the morning. Staff 1 reported she has
never threatened him in any type of way. Staff 1 reported she
doesn’t even joke with youth in that manner because she doesn’t
know what they’ve been through, and youth take it too far. Staff 1
reported she is aware because of the position she holds; she
cannot get mad and say anything she wants to towards the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 2/12/24. Staff 2 reported
whenever Youth A has had concerns, she has encouraged him to
talk to Therapist or a supervisor. Staff 2 reported she has never
heard Staff 1 threaten to physically harm Youth A or threaten him
in any other way. Staff 2 reported Youth A has never told her
anyone, including Staff 1, has threatened to physically harm him,
or threatened him in any other way. Staff 2 reported she is not
keeping a list of things Staff 1 does wrong, and she has no idea
why Youth A got that impression.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Wedgwood Christian Services Behavior Management
Procedures – Prohibited Techniques (rev. 4/18/18) states
corporal or physical punishment or threatening to use any
3

of these methods is prohibited. It also states the use of
profanity against a client is prohibited.
• There are no incident reports or shift logs documenting
anything about this alleged incident in September 2023.
• The facility does not have the schedule from September
2023 to see who might have been working during the same
shifts as Staff 1 and may have been witness to the alleged
incident.
• Staff 1 has no disciplinary records in her employee file.
Staff 1 completed Decreasing Behavior training on 5/14/23,
and Behavioral Challenges of Autism training on 5/25/23.
She also completed AEGIS trainings on 4/9/20, 9/17/20,
5/27/21, 9/16/21, 11/18/21, 5/12/22, 2/5/23, 5/15/23 and
11/20/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is not established as there is no evidence to support Staff
1 threatened Youth A. Youth A provided minimal details about the
incident and stated Staff 2 would have more information.
However, Staff 2 reported Youth A never told her Staff 1
threatened him in any type of way and has never heard Staff 1
threaten Youth A. Staff 1 reported she has never threatened
Youth A and is aware she cannot say anything threatening in a
joking or serious manner towards the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
